column1: Kulebaki (Russian: Кулеба́ки) is a town in Nizhny Novgorod Oblast
column3: located 188 kilometers (117 mi) southwest of Nizhny Novgorod
column4: the administrative center of the oblast. As of the 2010 Census

column1: The village of Kulebaki was first mentioned in 1719. Town status was granted to it in 1932.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column3: together with two work settlements (Gremyachevo and Veletma) and twenty-eight rural localities
column4: incorporated as the town of oblast significance of Kulebaki—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of oblast significance of Kulebaki is incorporated as Kulebaki Urban Okrug.Until May 2015
column6: the town served as the administrative center of Kulebaksky District and
column7: within the framework of administrative divisions
column8: was incorporated within that district as a town of district significance. As a municipal division
column9: it was incorporated as Kulebaki Urban Settlement within Kulebaksky Municipal District.

column3: founded in 1866 and originally producing equipment for railway industry
column4: is now producing components for aerospace industry as well.
